# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input_string, " ")
    result = IOBuffer()
    
    current_line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        
        if current_line_length + word_length + 1 > text_width # +1 for the space character
            print(result, "\n")
            current_line_length = 0
        else
            if !isempty(result.data) && result.data[end] != '\n'
                print(result, " ")
                current_line_length += 1
            end
        end
        
        print(result, word)
        current_line_length += word_length
    end
    
    return String(take!(result))
end

# Example usage:
input_string = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped onto multiple lines because it exceeds the specified text width."
println(wrap_string(input_string, 20))
```
